title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act is titled the "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" and includes an amendment regarding a review agreement for the 15th anniversary of the Compact. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions regarding the extension of Article X of the Agreement Regarding Federal Programs and Services. The Agreement between the United States and Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions regarding the extension of Article X of the Agreement. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance in fiscal year 2011 will be provided in fiscal year 2013. The Agreement between the United States and Palau, signed in 2010, includes provisions for funding infrastructure projects. Funding from the United States in fiscal years 2011 and 2012 will be provided in fiscal years 2012 and 2013, with a reduction of $411,000 in 2012. The United States will reduce funding by $411,000 in fiscal year 2012 for infrastructure projects in Palau under the Agreement. Congress consents to amendments in the Compact subsidiary agreements. Application of related law is specified in Section 105(f)(1)(B)(ix). Congress consents to amendments in the Compact subsidiary agreements, authorizing appropriations for postal services related to Palau and other Micronesian states from 2012 to 2024. Additionally, a related law is amended to substitute '2024' for '2009'. Congress consents to appropriations of $1,500,000 annually from 2012 to 2024 for postal services in Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands. The Department of the Interior can transfer funds to the United States Postal Service for this purpose. The United States Postal Service can use domestic postage for mail to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands until 2024. Appropriations for postal services in these countries can continue through 2024 and remain available until expended. The successors of Federal entities with appropriations in fiscal year 2011 can use funds until 2024 for specified purposes. Full faith and credit apply to commitments under the Compact Review Agreement. The Congress finds that the Government of Palau is eligible for certain United States domestic programs and the Secretary of the Interior is required to submit an annual report to appropriate Congressional committees. The Congress finds that Palau is eligible for US domestic programs, and the Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to Congressional committees. The Secretary of the Interior must annually report to Congressional committees on the use and effectiveness of assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. The Secretary of the Interior must consult with relevant Federal agencies when preparing annual reports on assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. Repeal of Prior Authorization for Civil Administration of Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and Limitation on Use of Funds for Global Health Programs. The text chunk prohibits funds for global health activities to be used for assistance to China from 2012 to 2024, with a reduction of $2,000,000 annually. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted. The text chunk amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to include provisions for climate change funds. The text chunk includes a limitation on the use of funds related to climate change under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The text chunk imposes a limitation on funds for climate change activities for fiscal years 2012-2024, specifically prohibiting assistance to China for such activities. The total amount available for climate change activities is reduced by $4,500,000 annually. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted. The text chunk prohibits funding for the Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) program for fiscal years 2012 and 2013 by the United States Agency for International Development. The text chunk amends Section 542 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 regarding funding for the Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) program by the United States Agency for International Development. The text chunk amends Section 542 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to limit funds for providing assistance to Argentina from fiscal year 2012 through fiscal year 2024. The text chunk limits funds for providing assistance to Argentina from fiscal year 2012 through fiscal year 2024, with a reduction of $4,500,000 in total amount available for such activities. This subsection applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include a provision regarding UNESCO, regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. SEC. 308 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 limits the use of funds for United States contributions to UNESCO. The total amount for such contributions is reduced by $4,500,000 annually from 2012 to 2024. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. SEC. 308 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 limits US contributions to UNESCO by $4,500,000 annually from 2012 to 2024. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. Additionally, the United States Institute of Peace has a limitation on funds totaling $6,811,000 for fiscal year 2012 and each year through 2024. The total amount of funds that may be obligated for the United States Institute of Peace for fiscal year 2012 and each year through 2024 is limited to $6,811,000, which is $4,500,000 less than the total amount available for such purpose for each fiscal year. This limitation applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment.
